intro: Gretheria, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. These plants are typically found in temperate regions and thrive in well-drained soils. Gretheria species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens. They produce small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds.
